about.title: Logbot Starter Catalog
about.note: Starter set with canonical controls, mappings, and two example profiles.

frameworks_hint.name: System security requirements and security levels
Technical security requirements for IACS components

controls.objective: Enforce strong remote administrative access for OT.
controls.statement: Require all remote administrative access to OT networks to traverse a managed jump service that enforces MFA and policy-based authorization.

params.name: mfa_required
params.description: Require MFA for remote admin access

checklist.question: Is all OT remote admin access brokered via a jump service with MFA?
Provide gateway policy export and MFA settings.

controls.objective: Ensure unique accountability for privileged users.
controls.statement: Require unique, non-shared administrator accounts with least-privilege and periodic entitlement review for OT systems.

checklist.question: Are admin accounts unique and reviewed at least quarterly?
Upload last access review report for OT administrators.

controls.statement: Enforce privileged access management (PAM) for OT-critical systems, including checkout/approval for break-glass access and session monitoring.

params.name: pam_required
params.description: PAM required for OT critical assets

checklist.question: Is PAM enforced for OT-critical systems?
Provide PAM policy and example session record.

controls.objective: Protect and rotate service account credentials.
controls.statement: Manage OT service accounts with scoped privileges, vault-stored secrets, and automated rotation.

checklist.question: Are service account secrets vaulted and rotated on schedule?
Upload rotation logs or vault policy export.

controls.statement: Implement session timeout, lockout thresholds, and re-authentication for high-risk actions on OT admin interfaces.

params.name: session_timeout_minutes
params.description: Idle timeout for OT admin sessions

checklist.question: Is idle timeout enabled on OT admin consoles?

controls.statement: Implement zone-and-conduit segmentation with deny-by-default ACLs between OT zones and DMZ, allowing only approved industrial protocols and flows.

checklist.question: Are inter-zone ACLs deny-by-default with approved allowlists?
Provide firewall export for OT↔DMZ conduits.

controls.statement: Terminate external remote access in a managed DMZ and proxy into OT through controlled conduits only.

checklist.question: Is remote access terminated in DMZ and proxied into OT?

controls.statement: Allowlist and inspect industrial protocols (e.g., Modbus, Profinet) and block cleartext management protocols in OT.

checklist.question: Is protocol allowlisting configured on OT firewalls/IDS?

controls.objective: Protect critical zones with constrained flows.
controls.statement: Enforce unidirectional gateways (data diode) or protocol brokers for data egress from safety-critical OT zones.

params.name: unidirectional_required
params.description: Require unidirectional tech for critical zones

checklist.question: Are unidirectional gateways or brokers deployed for critical zones?

controls.objective: Control changes to network security baselines.
controls.statement: Apply formal change control, rule justification, and periodic recertification for OT firewall/ACL policies.

checklist.question: Are OT firewall rules recertified on schedule with business justification?

controls.objective: Maintain an OT vulnerability management process.
controls.statement: Maintain an asset-based vulnerability management process for OT, including discovery, risk rating, remediation tracking, and exceptions.

params.name: scan_frequency_days
params.description: Days between OT vuln scans (where safe)

checklist.question: Is there an OT vulnerability management register with owners and due dates?
Provide last remediation status report.

controls.statement: Test and validate patches in a representative OT testbed and deploy within approved maintenance windows with rollback plans.

params.name: patch_window_days
params.description: Target days to deploy OT patches after validation

checklist.question: Are OT patches tested in a lab before deployment?

controls.objective: Apply compensating controls when patching is infeasible.
controls.statement: When vendor support or downtime constraints prevent patching, implement compensating controls such as network isolation, application allowlisting, and brokered remote access.

checklist.question: Is there a documented compensating control plan for unpatchable assets?

controls.statement: Track vendor security advisories for OT components and assess applicability and risk within defined SLAs.

checklist.question: Is there a subscription/monitoring for vendor advisories with documented triage?

controls.objective: Collect and centralize OT security logs.
controls.statement: Forward security-relevant logs from OT gateways, servers, and brokers to a central SIEM with constrained connectivity.

params.name: log_retention_days
params.description: Days to retain OT security logs

checklist.question: Are OT logs forwarded to a central SIEM?
Provide SIEM ingestion dashboard or sample.

controls.statement: Use trustworthy NTP/PTP sources and secure time distribution to ensure timestamp integrity across OT assets and collectors.

checklist.question: Is time synchronization enforced and monitored for OT logging components?

controls.statement: Deploy OT-aware IDS/monitoring to detect anomalous OT protocol activity and policy violations.

checklist.question: Is an OT-aware IDS deployed with alerting to SOC?

controls.statement: Protect OT logs against tampering and retain them for the defined period to support investigations and legal holds.

checklist.question: Are OT logs write-once or integrity-protected?

controls.statement: Maintain OT incident response playbooks including detection, containment, safe-state procedures, recovery, and post-incident review.

params.name: rto_hours
params.description: Target Recovery Time Objective for essential OT services

checklist.question: Do playbooks cover safe-state criteria and safety escalation?

controls.objective: Record remote admin sessions for forensics.
controls.statement: Record and securely store remote administrative session metadata and, where permissible, session content for forensic analysis.

checklist.question: Are admin sessions recorded and retained per policy?

controls.statement: Conduct periodic OT-focused incident exercises including external stakeholders and safety functions.

checklist.question: Has an OT IR exercise been conducted within the last 6 months?

controls.objective: Back up critical OT configurations securely.
controls.statement: Maintain offline or immutable backups of OT device configurations, engineering workstations, and historian data essential for recovery.

checklist.question: Are OT configuration backups offline/immutable and recent?

controls.statement: Perform periodic restore tests for critical OT assets and document results and timing versus objectives.

checklist.question: Provide last OT restore test report/log.

controls.objective: Protect backups from ransomware and sabotage.
controls.statement: Apply access controls, network isolation, and integrity checks to OT backups to prevent unauthorized alteration or deletion.

checklist.question: Are OT backup repositories access-controlled and isolated?

controls.objective: Impose supplier security requirements for IACS.
controls.statement: Define and enforce supplier security requirements aligned to IEC 62443-4-1/-4-2 for components and integration services.

checklist.question: Do contracts include IEC 62443-4-1/-4-2 aligned requirements?

controls.statement: Ensure contracts and technical controls for remote maintenance enforce brokered access, MFA, monitoring, and session recording.

checklist.question: Do maintenance contracts mandate brokered access with MFA and monitoring?

controls.objective: Consume and verify SBOMs for OT software.
controls.statement: Require SBOMs from suppliers and verify component vulnerabilities and licenses before deployment.

checklist.question: Are SBOMs provided and checked before integrating software?

controls.objective: Operate a PSIRT and Coordinated Vulnerability Disclosure (CVD).
controls.statement: Maintain a Product Security Incident Response Team with public CVD policy, intake, triage, and advisory publication.

params.name: advisory_sla_days
params.description: Days to publish security advisory after fix/mitigation

checklist.question: Is a public CVD/PSIRT process documented and active?

controls.objective: Apply threat modeling to IACS products.
controls.statement: Perform and maintain threat models for products and features, covering misuse of OT protocols and interfaces.

checklist.question: Are threat models maintained for releases and reviewed?

controls.statement: Enforce automated static and dynamic security testing in CI/CD with policy gates for severity and coverage.

checklist.question: Do pipelines enforce SAST/DAST gates before release?

controls.statement: Generate and publish SBOM for every product release with component hashes and licenses.

checklist.question: Is SBOM generated and published for each release?

controls.statement: Publish VEX or equivalent statements to communicate exploitability and mitigations for known component CVEs.

checklist.question: Are VEX statements issued for relevant CVEs?

controls.objective: Implement secure boot and signed firmware.
controls.statement: Enforce cryptographic signature verification for firmware and a chain of trust from bootloader to application.

checklist.question: Is firmware signature verification enforced at boot?

controls.objective: Assess privacy risks in OT processing.
controls.statement: Perform Data Protection Impact Assessment (DPIA) where OT systems process personal data or monitoring of operators.

checklist.question: Has a DPIA been conducted for OT processing of personal data?

controls.statement: Maintain records of processing activities (ROPA) and data processing agreements with OT service providers.

checklist.question: Are ROPA and DPAs in place for OT-related processing?

controls.statement: Conduct safety–security co-engineering reviews to ensure security measures do not degrade safety functions and vice versa.

checklist.question: Are co-engineering reviews documented with actions and approvals?

controls.statement: Define and validate safe-state criteria and interlocks in incident response playbooks for OT.

checklist.question: Do playbooks include tested safe-state actions and interlocks?

controls.objective: Control physical access to OT areas.
controls.statement: Restrict and monitor physical access to OT zones and protect cabinets, panels, and field devices against unauthorized access.

checklist.question: Are OT areas controlled with access lists and monitoring?

profiles.name: OT Asset Owner — SL2 Operations
profiles.description: Operational baseline for OT Asset Owners at IEC 62443 SL2 with GDPR/NIS2 overlays where applicable.

profiles.name: Manufacturer — CRA/62443 SDLC
profiles.description: Baseline for product manufacturers aligning with CRA and IEC 62443-4-1/-4-2 secure development and vulnerability handling.
